alert.note: Alert for Delta; Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 25 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Upper Michigan, including the following counties, Delta and Schoolcraft. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 855 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. During the night into this morning, between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen with isolated amounts up to 8 inches. - Some locations that will experience flooding and considerable standing water include... M-94 between Steuben and Manistique and Blaney Park. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
